static std::string sys::Path::absolutePath ( const std::string &  path  )  [static]

Return a normalized absolutized verion of the pathname supplied.

static std::string sys::Path::basename ( const std::string &  path,
bool  removeExt = false 
) [static]

Returns the base name of the path supplied. This is the second half of the pair returned by splitPath()

static const char* sys::Path::delimiter (  )  [static]

Returns the path delimiter

static std::string sys::Path::joinPaths ( const std::string &  path1,
const std::string &  path2 
) [static]

Joins two paths together, using the OS-specific delimiter.

static std::string sys::Path::normalizePath ( const std::string &  path  )  [static]

Normalizes a pathname. Collapses redundant separators and up-level references. On Windows, it converts forward slashes to backward slashes.

static const char* sys::Path::separator (  )  [static]

Returns the path separator

static StringPair sys::Path::splitDrive ( const std::string &  path  )  [static]

Splits the path it into two components: drive & tail.

For systems that do not support drive specifications, drive will always be the empty string. drive + tail = path

static StringPair sys::Path::splitExt ( const std::string &  path  )  [static]

Splits the pathname into two components: root & ext.

The returned pair will contain the root of the path plus the extension, if one exists. You can combine the returned pair to create the original path.

static StringPair sys::Path::splitPath ( const std::string &  path  )  [static]

Splits the path into two components: head & tail.

The tail part will never contain the delim; if path ends in the delim, tail will be empty. If there is no delim in path, head will be empty.
